member.summary: This class will create an object of a given type and populate it with sample data.

member.name: M:MusicApi.Areas.HelpPage.ObjectGenerator.GenerateObject(System.Type)
member.summary: Generates an object for a given type. The type needs to be public, have a public default constructor and settable public properties/fields. Currently it supports the following types: Simple types: , , , , , etc. Complex types: POCO types. Nullables: . Arrays: arrays of simple types or complex types. Key value pairs: Tuples: , , etc Dictionaries: or anything deriving from . Collections: , , , , , or anything deriving from or . Queryables: , .
member.returns: An object of the given type.

member.summary: Indicates whether the sample is used for request or response

member.name: M:MusicApi.Controllers.AlbumsController.GetAllAlbums
member.summary: Returns all albums in the database, sorted by Band.
member.returns: An IEnumerable list of Album objects, with link relations.

member.name: M:MusicApi.Controllers.AlbumsController.GetAlbum(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a specific Album given an Album Id.
member.param: The unique Id of the Album to return.
member.returns: An Album object, with link relations.

member.name: M:MusicApi.Controllers.AlbumsController.GetAlbumsByGenre(System.String)
member.summary: Returns all Albums in the database of a given genre.
member.param: The text value of the genre to search for.
member.returns: IEnumerable list of Albums meeting the search criteria, empty collection if none found.

member.name: M:MusicApi.Controllers.AlbumsController.PostAlbum(MusicApi.Models.Request.AlbumRequest)
member.summary: POSTs an Album to the database.

member.name: M:MusicApi.Controllers.AlbumsController.DeleteAlbum(System.Int32)
member.summary: DELETEs an Album from the database.
member.returns: 200 OK on success, 404 Not Found if Album does not exist, 500 Internal Server Error on failure.
member.param: The integer Album ID to delete.

member.summary: POSTs a Band to the database.

member.summary: DELETEs a Band from the database.

member.name: M:Dapper.SqlMapper.Query(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.String,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Data.CommandType})
member.summary: Return a list of dynamic objects, reader is closed after the call

member.name: M:Dapper.SqlMapper.Query``1(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.String,System.Object,System.Data.IDbTransaction,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Data.CommandType})
member.summary: Executes a query, returning the data typed as per T
member.remarks: the dynamic param may seem a bit odd, but this works around a major usability issue in vs, if it is Object vs completion gets annoying. Eg type new [space] get new object
member.returns: A sequence of data of the supplied type; if a basic type (int, string, etc) is queried then the data from the first column in assumed, otherwise an instance is created per row, and a direct column-name===member-name mapping is assumed (case insensitive).

member.summary: Execute a command that returns multiple result sets, and access each in turn

member.name: P:Dapper.SqlMapper.ConnectionStringComparer
member.summary: How should connection strings be compared for equivalence? Defaults to StringComparer.Ordinal. Providing a custom implementation can be useful for allowing multi-tenancy databases with identical schema to share startegies. Note that usual equivalence rules apply: any equivalent connection strings MUST yield the same hash-code.

member.name: T:Dapper.SqlMapper.Link`2
member.summary: This is a micro-cache; suitable when the number of terms is controllable (a few hundred, for example), and strictly append-only; you cannot change existing values. All key matches are on **REFERENCE** equality. The type is fully thread-safe.
